raw.title: [BIP-741] Grant V3 Permissions to Maxis and Emergency DAO Multisigs
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
As per [BIP-734](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-734-balancer-v3-launch-and-protocol-enhancements/6168), Balancer V3 contracts have successfully been deployed to Ethereum and Gnosis! In order to both (1) call emergency functions (2) manage pool settings, it is proposed that the following existing multisigs are granted the following roles by the authorizer:

## Emergency DAO

- `VaultAdmin.pauseVault`
- `VaultAdmin.unpauseVault`
- `VaultAdmin.pausePool`
- `VaultAdmin.unpausePool`
- `VaultAdmin.pauseVaultBuffers`
- `VaultAdmin.unpauseVaultBuffers`
- `VaultAdmin.enableRecoveryMode`
- `VaultAdmin.disableRecoveryMode`
- `VaultAdmin.enableQuery`
- `VaultAdmin.disableQuery`
- `VaultAdmin.disableQueryPermanently`
- `StablePoolFactory.disable`
- `WeightedPoolFactory.disable`

## Maxis

- `VaultAdmin.setStaticSwapFeePercentage`
- `StablePool.startAmplificationParameterUpdate`
- `StablePool.stopAmplificationParameterUpdate`
- `ProtocolFeeController.setGlobalProtocolSwapFeePercentage`
- `ProtocolFeeController.setGlobalProtocolYieldFeePercentage`
- `ProtocolFeeController.setProtocolSwapFeePercentage`
- `ProtocolFeeController.setProtocolYieldFeePercentage`
- `ProtocolFeeController.withdrawProtocolFees`
- `ProtocolFeeController.withdrawProtocolFeesForToken`

# Payload

The required payload can be found [on our GitHub repo](https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1535) and can be summarised as follows:
```

|                       |                     |                                            | 20241204-v3-vault/ProtocolFeeController/setGlobalProtocolSwapFeePercentage(uint256)           | 0x31893078b6590802f57d29fae81f10113c336375df90db2aed0392af0c75d8d4 |     |          |
```

cleaned.title: [BIP-778] Grant Maxis StableSurge Parameter Change Permissions
cleaned.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516

raw.title: [BIP-778] Grant Maxis StableSurge Parameter Change Permissions
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
PR with payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1755

### Summary & Motivation

The [StableSurge](https://medium.com/balancer-protocol/balancers-stablesurge-hook-09d2eb20f219) hook has been deployed by the Balancer Labs team marking an exciting milestone for Balancer V3 as the first wave of hooks are hitting production. With these innovations come additional permissions related to the management of each hooks unique parameters. In the case of StableSurge the maxSurgeFeePercentage and surgeThresholdPercentage are key factors in determining how the hook will affect the pool performance and the liquidity providers. This proposal will act to grant the permissions to change both of these parameters to the Balancer Maxis on all currently deployed networks, Ethereum Mainnet, Gnosis, Arbitrum, and Base.

**Technical Specification:**

All deployments and action-ids can be verified in this StableSurgePoolFactory [pull request](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/pull/163/files#diff-17e7d1b01753c19be2eee514c14e09736db3af94d24025c7fd9876c73b6e7950).

**Ethereum**

On Mainnet the Balancer DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0x2f27aa67b6bf44b4441ea2656c22e09252261845a98dc577a6fc06b6526f8bcc`, `0x66c657ea0d5ce1dc0286795937131c61620bb6ccd0f126fbfe3799d8b89a9753`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

**Arbitrum**

On Arbitrum the Balancer DAO Multisig `0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0x261258d23af1013ceb3a0574a5f194e3d4d09a07c0b9014665519c3f1b37f792`, `0x5968f4b1f98171ccadc78df4f25cf8262b250f2f12a83c45b7311b4674d23e0a`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

**Base**

On Base the Balancer DAO Multisig `0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462` will interact with the Authorizer `0x809B79b53F18E9bc08A961ED4678B901aC93213a` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0xe81edd4ccc5901443972e580b5d997ced38f33bd4f7e9bca8829dc5efcca6fed`, `0x4a7d099f7d634af69cf552b5b1c76ed8d44074051cbca5a59b842154288b96f1`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

**Gnosis**

On Gnosis the Balancer DAO Multisig `0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0x2f27aa67b6bf44b4441ea2656c22e09252261845a98dc577a6fc06b6526f8bcc`, `0x66c657ea0d5ce1dc0286795937131c61620bb6ccd0f126fbfe3799d8b89a9753`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

choices: No, this is not the way

cleaned.title: [BIP-315] Add Single Recipient Gauge to Checkpointer
cleaned.author: 0x512fce9B07Ce64590849115EE6B32fd40eC0f5F3

raw.title: [BIP-315] Add Single Recipient Gauge to Checkpointer
raw.author: 0x512fce9B07Ce64590849115EE6B32fd40eC0f5F3
raw.body:
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/232

### Motivation

The recent release of the L2 gauge checkpointer for automating the bridging of BAL rewards can also be used to automate the distribution of BAL to single recipient gauges like veLIT and veUSH. In order for this to function properly the factory to create single recipient gauges must be added to the gauge adder v4.

### Specification
1.
If approved, the DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will initiate a transaction to interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRoles` with the following arguments:

roles: `[0x2960d085c4c968d7cad55c0da3f97014525b948fdce990ecaef4e832b5f0b151,0x3f44776af02a9227991da37715b44e45db40735e216b3ab33144859bb6737166]`

These correspond to the roles for calling `addGaugeType` and `setGaugeFactory` on the Gauge Adder v4, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#L1342). 

address: `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f`

This is the address for the DAO Multisig to allow it to call the above functions.

2.
The DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will initiate a transaction to interact with the Gauge Adder v4 `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` calling `addGaugeType` with the following argument:

gaugeType: `EthereumSingleRecipientGauge`

3. 
The DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will initiate a transaction to interact with the Gauge Adder v4 `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` calling `setGaugeFactory` with the following arguments:

factory: `0x4fb47126fa83a8734991e41b942ac29a3266c968`
gaugeType: `EthereumSingleRecipientGauge`

4.
the DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will initiate a transaction to interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `renounceRoles` with the following arguments:

roles: `[0x2960d085c4c968d7cad55c0da3f97014525b948fdce990ecaef4e832b5f0b151,0x3f44776af02a9227991da37715b44e45db40735e216b3ab33144859bb6737166]`

These correspond to the roles for calling `addGaugeType` and `setGaugeFactory` on the Gauge Adder v4, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#L1342). 

address: `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f`

This is the address for the DAO Multisig to remove the ability for it to call the above functions.

choices: No, this is not the way

cleaned.title: [BIP-787] Grant Maxis Amplification Parameter Change Permissions for StableSurge Pools
cleaned.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17

raw.title: [BIP-787] Grant Maxis Amplification Parameter Change Permissions for StableSurge Pools
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1784

**Summary & Motivation**

In order for StableSurge to continue to gain adoption, the flexibility for the amplification factor to be changed allows for more or less slippage between the pairs in the pool. Due to the nature of stable surge, the end goal is to allow for more efficient swaps and charge higher fees when volatility occurs. The permission to manage this parameter will give the hook maximum opportunity for success.

Reference the deployments [repository](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/tree/bbe1ebb272b8b3085a7b91c33ff997ff72520327/action-ids) to confirm the corresponding action-ids. For example Base can be seen [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/bbe1ebb272b8b3085a7b91c33ff997ff72520327/action-ids/base/action-ids.json#L514). 

Technical Specification:

The DAO Multisig on each network, Ethereum, Gnosis, Base, and Arbitrum will write the respective `Authorizer` calling `grantRoles` with the respective roles for `startAmplificationParameterUpdate` and `stopAmplificationParameterUpdate` for StableSurge factory created pools, the role will be granted to `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e` on all networks.. This will correspond to the following table.

|Network|DAO Multisig Address|Authorizer Address|startAmplificationParameterUpdate Role|stopAmplificationParameterUpdate Role|
|---|---|---|---|---|
|Ethereum|0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f|0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6|0x3050dfbb6294dc29c5cae13acb241fddea61d345d9b8c809f216c8259b013ff8|0x866d7d17a9b007d202e4da84f38a0bfbb310db8184a4f1d2e6de3c8e78ecd1e0|
|Gnosis|0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18|0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6|0x4acf55e494b685b95a5b14cf8c5507d75bd1aa71a85fc1214c0e8b825a469170|0x472cb2d86bd228ad5c01dda464760927533d1f2075d5857fb2c01bfee9790125|
|Base|0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462|0x809B79b53F18E9bc08A961ED4678B901aC93213a|0xbf865f1c6f8d104fabfc55638d1622f92901741c27314f329670c51b54f3eded|0x1a357d5b1643481255960a2981adcdd96069c98aff413a5e8387d5e199d34a64|
|Arbitrum|0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0|0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6|0x2fbb47746d921903b9f91d439cf9e524a40a377607923d64f01c38c5d0ea1b14|0xdecec4789661e9e43897955fb7d3796d8f5159ba0cc6593dbf71f88c8f4da475|

choices: No, this is not the way

cleaned.title: [BIP-651] Authorize Mimic Smart Vaults v3 on Optimism
cleaned.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516

raw.title: [BIP-651] Authorize Mimic Smart Vaults v3 on Optimism
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
**Motivation:**

The Balancer / Beethoven X joint deployment on Optimism is currently Mimicâ€™s smart vault v2 architecture to process fees. We are now ready to migrate to their v3 architecture, similarly to how it has already been done on other Balancer deployments [BIP-488](https://snapshot.org/#/balancer.eth/proposal/0x897aba7b7f3a68867595fea782931da3aae10fc15c62d8ace8cbd8e923ac07c4), [BIP-552](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-552-authorize-mimic-smart-vaults-v3-on-arbitrum-polygon-and-gnosis/5589). The instructions and addresses of the Mimic v3 deployment on Optimism can be found [here](https://mimic-fi.notion.site/Beethoven-Enviroment-guide-8d5ca1c6bad048bab6bce4d12244d7fe).

Permissions of the currently in use smart vault v2 will be revoked once smart vault v3 fee processing is fully operational.

**Specification:**

The DAO Multisig on Optimism `0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` and call `grantRole` with the following arguments:


role: `0x5a57bdde85c7a823e064d8cdc9a9a1b617f739068ec8925eaf6a562aa22513c6`


which corresponds to the role for calling withdrawCollectedFees on the ProtocolFeeWithdrawer on Optimism, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/d280e55dbe0fe4a2570912567fc7ccbf3dbbe1d7/action-ids/optimism/action-ids.json#L160).


account: `0x9e5d6427d2cdadc68870197b099c2df535ec3c97`


which is the contract address for the Mimic smart vault on Optimism.

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: This proposal grants permissions to the Balancer Maxis multisig to control MEV tax hook parameters to optimize MEV capture. Voting timeline and power strongly favor approval. Forum discussion is neutral. Historical similar proposals successfully enabled new protocol features with unanimous support.
key_arguments_for: Unanimous early and stable vote support with majority vote power backing 'Yes, let's do it'.
Proposal enables configurable MEV tax parameters to optimize MEV capture, enhancing protocol control.
Similar past proposals enabling new features passed unanimously and improved protocol capabilities.
Forum discussion shows neutral sentiment, indicating no community opposition.
key_arguments_against: Current market price impact shows a decline (-7.07%), which may indicate short-term uncertainty.
Slight positive TVL impact (+1.15%) but market reaction needs monitoring post implementation.

evidence.quote: Forum discussion contains 2 neutral comments, no positive or negative sentiment detected.
Voting timeline shows unanimous early support and stable lead for 'Yes, let's do it' with strong voting power.
Similar past proposals to enable new pools or gauges passed unanimously with 'Yes, let's do it' but saw minor negative price and TVL impact.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.simulation_reason: Recommendation based on timeline vote patterns, forum sentiment, and historical analogous proposals for durable organizational benefit.
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- The voting timeline shows consistent and unanimous support for the 'Yes, let's do it' option, backed by strong voting power.
- Forum sentiment is neutral with no opposition, indicating community acceptance or lack of strong objection.
- Similar past proposals enabling protocol parameter control passed unanimously and improved governance capabilities despite minor negative market reactions.
- Market data for this proposal shows price decline but slight TVL increase; no post-vote market impact used in recommendation.
- The recommendation aligns with aggregated voting sentiment and supports protocol adaptability and improved MEV tax parameter control for long-term benefit.
